title: The login server did not respond.
body:
G'DAY C***S! For some reason I'm getting the error you get when you try to login. Blah blah server unresponsive, check connection and check the server status. Blah. 

Going through the suggested help stuff...

Check the selected region in the client? OCEANIA
Check if the server is up? YES
Syncing Windows Clock? 18/02/2015, 2:40 PERTH TIME
Internet Explorer Offline mode? WINDOWS 8.1
Reinstalling Internet Explorer? "Looking for Internet Explorer?  Guess what? Your system already has the latest version installed!"
Microsoft Support? I got some error saying the fixit was incompatible with my version of windows explorer. "The microsoft fixit does not apply to your operating system or application version"
Using Updated Security Protocols 2.0 and 3.0 disabled, 1.0 enabled the TLS one. Y'know.
Disable Peer to Peer transfers? This sure was scraping the bottom of the barrel guiseeee
Uninstall Pando Media Booster? Don't have it.
Configure your DNS? Neither  "Obtain DNS server address automatically" or "Use the following DNS server addresses:" are present in the menu as it's a wifi connection.

PLEASE XIBIT (riot), PIMP MY LEAGUE OF LEGENDS CLIENT!{{champion:50}}

replies.body: Update: for some reason the wifi (which I have been using 5 eva) was suddenly the cause, the goddamn 15 metre ethernet cable to my room solved it, any idea why? And whether swapping back to wifi could sill be viable?

Hey 

Wifi can be a bit hit or miss, depending on what else is set up nearby.  Are there other wireless networks nearby (neighbours?) that might be interfering?

That kind of thing can kick in for no apparent reason and can cause strange intermittent problems like this.  I've just spent a couple of weeks fixing up my own home network for this reason.

The short answer is nothing beats a cable, but you may be able to take some steps to stabilise the wifi quite a bit.

Mindstar

I read this with the most Steve Irwin-inspired Australian accent I could muster.

>Configure your DNS? Neither "Obtain DNS server address automatically" or "Use the following DNS server addresses:" are present in the menu as it's a wifi connection.

You should be able to configure your DNS no matter how you're connected to the internet. This setting is related to your ISP, not your connection, necessarily.

On Windows 8.1, go to your Control Panel, **not PC settings**, and then go to Network and Sharing. If you can't find it, then you can just right-click the networking icon in your taskbar and then select "Open Network and Sharing Center". Click "Change adapter settings", right click your adapter and click "Properties", scroll down to the bottom and select the one with IPv4 in it somewhere and then click "Properties" again, and BAM, you can change your DNS.

8.8.8.8 as primary and 8.8.4.4 as secondary.

You should be able to use your wifi connection if you do this.
Oh, and I'm posting here as I have about 3 emails for different accounts and.. Tl;dr I can't login to support without it being a major pain in the backside
